qas.question: Who is in control of the organization?
Who does the board hire to help with running the organization?
How is the board of directors most often chosen?
How is a board of directors less commonly chosen?
Where, on Form 990, does an organization have to list what type of board they have?
What does the executive director have ultimate control of?
How is the executive director commonly elected?

plausible_answers.text: nominate new members and vote on their fellow directors nominations

qas.question: What do board members do when they have an executive director?
What is the job status of an executive director?

plausible_answers.text: Part VI, section A, question 7a of the Form 990

qas.question: Where does the executive director need to list what type of board the organization has?

context: The <a0_0>board of directors<a0_0/> has ultimate control over <b5_0>the organization<b5_0/>, but typically an <a1_0>executive director<a1_0/> is hired. In some cases, the board is <a3_0>elected <b6_0>by a membership<b6_0/><a3_0/>, but commonly, the board of directors is <a2_0><b8_0>self-perpetuating<b8_0/><a2_0/>. In these "board-only" organizations, board members <b7_0>nominate new members and vote on their fellow directors nominations<b7_0/>. <a4_0><b9_0>Part VI, section A, question 7a<a4_0/> of the Form 990<b9_0/> asks "members, stockholders, or other persons who had the power to elect or appoint one or more members of the governing body?".
